name: crankily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows that you are easily annoyed or upset: "Give me a minute," he answered crankily. When my toddler wakes at six, I crankily try to persuade him to go back to sleep.
in a way that is strange and unusual: His mother was crankily religious and read him the story of Noah every time it rained heavily. The monastery is now a ghost-ridden and crankily characterful hotel.
More examplesFewer examplesThe children rubbed their eyes crankily, like bears.She wanted to stay and play with her friends for a while, but her father was crankily trying to hurry her home.He sat crankily in his armchair, arguing with his wife.
